solution_line_template: Ruth's two cousins ate a total of {num_other_cousins} x {sandwiches_per_other_cousin} = <<{num_other_cousins}*{sandwiches_per_other_cousin}={sandwiches_eaten_by_other_cousins}>>{sandwiches_eaten_by_other_cousins} sandwiches.

So there were {sandwiches_left_after_all} + {sandwiches_eaten_by_other_cousins} = <<{sandwiches_left_after_all}+{sandwiches_eaten_by_other_cousins}={sandwiches_left_before_other_cousins}>>{sandwiches_left_before_other_cousins} sandwiches left before her two cousins arrived.

Before her first cousin arrived, there were {sandwiches_left_before_other_cousins} + {sandwiches_eaten_by_first_cousin} = <<{sandwiches_left_before_other_cousins}+{sandwiches_eaten_by_first_cousin}={sandwiches_left_before_first_cousin}>>{sandwiches_left_before_first_cousin} sandwiches.

Ruth and her brother had {sandwiches_eaten_by_ruth} + {sandwiches_given_to_brother} = <<{sandwiches_eaten_by_ruth}+{sandwiches_given_to_brother}={sandwiches_eaten_by_ruth_and_brother}>>{sandwiches_eaten_by_ruth_and_brother} sandwiches altogether.
